meaningMnemonic:
When you follow <kanji>standard</kanji> procedure to <kanji>provide</kanji> what's needed, you make the perfect <vocabulary>preparation</vocabulary>!

Both 準備 and 用意 mean "preparation," but 準備 means preparing in advance for an event, whereas 用意 implies taking appropriate measures. So, 準備 is better for planning a party, while 用意 fits well when making sure you have enough snacks for your guests.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
